page.title: 03Local History
page.content: Hatfield Peverel is a very old village the site of the Roman road from London to Colchester runs though the centre. The word Hatfield means a clearing in wild uncultivated ground, and Peverel comes from Ranulph de Peverel who owned the village after the Norman Conquest. Ranulph de Peverel married Ingelrica, a former mistress of William the Conqueror. Ingelrica built a priory in the village where she lived for the last fifteen years of her life to make up for the misdeeds of her youth. The original priory no longer remains but the village still has its Norman church. Legend has it that Ingelrica would be caught by the devil whether she was buried inside the church or out, so she was buried in the walls.
